channel.title: Park alerts
channel.description: Changes to conditions in Queensland's national parks, marine parks and forests.

item.title: Walking track closures due to wildfires
item.description: The following walking tracks are closed due to recent wildfires at Cunninghams Gap and Goomburra:- Mt.Cordeaux, Bare Rock, Palm Grove, Gap Creek Falls, Cascades Circuit and Ridge. The wildfire at Cunninghams Gap has not yet affected the walking tracks however a sudden change in fire activity could result in hazardous conditions. The wildfire at Goomburra has affected the tracks. Falling trees now make this area hazardous. At this stage some of these tracks may be closed for more than 2 weeks. Affected parks: Main Range National Park.

item.title: Sections of Neurum Creek Road closed for causeway repairs
item.description: Due to causeway repairs in Mt Mee section, D'Aguilar National Park parts of Neurum Creek Road will be closed from Monday 15 October through to Friday 26 October 2012. Closures will occur between the intersection of Neurum Creek Road and Mill Rainforest Road through to Neurum Creek Road and Rocky Hole Access Road junction. Mill Rainforest walk is still accessible. Rocky Hole can still be accessed via Lovedays road then L Traverse road. Neurum Creek campground will be closed. Affected parks: D'Aguilar National Park.

item.title: Pyramid Campground, Porcupine Gorge National Park reopened..
item.description: The Pyramid Campground has reopened for visitors. Affected parks: Porcupine Gorge National Park.

item.title: Partial closure of Koolmoon Creek track, Misty Mountains wilderness walking tracks
item.description: Koolmoon Creek track is impassable in the vicinity of Rhyolite Pinnacle due to heavy plant growth. All other sections of the track are open (Cochable Creek camping area to Djilgarrin or Walters Waterhole trailheads, and Koolmoon Creek headwaters trailhead to Rhyolite Pinnacle trailhead) but the track cannot be walked in its entirety. Affected parks: Misty Mountains wilderness walking tracks.

item.title: Wildfires causing smoke hazard at Goodliffe and Salvator Rosa
item.description: Wildfires near the National Park are causing a smoke hazard for the Goodliffe and Salvator Rosa sections. Travellers should not travel on the Wilderness Way Road due the wildfires. Affected parks: Salvator Rosa Carnarvon National Park.

item.title: Walking track closures due to wildfires
item.description: All walking tracks within Ravensbourne National Park are closed due to wildfires. This includes the Rainforest circuit, Palm creek circuit and Buaraba Creek Track. Affected parks: Ravensbourne National Park.

item.title: Take care in Lonesome section, Expedition National Park - fires approaching/smoke hazard
item.description: Fires approaching Lonesome section, Expedition National Park. Exercise caution entering the park, there may be smoke hazards along roads. Affected parks: Expedition National Park.

item.title: Maintenance work on Hinchinbrook Island NP
item.description: The toilets at South Macushla camping area are not operational. Please use the toilet at the nearby North Macushla camping area. Maintenance and construction work on the toilets at North and South Macushla camping areas will take place from Thuirsday 24 October to Friday 14 December. Both camping areas and the toilet at North Macushla will remain open, but machinery and staff will be present. The toilet at South Macushla will remain close Affected parks: Hinchinbrook Island National Park.

item.title: Maintenance work at Zoe Bay camping area, Hinchinbrok Island National Park.
item.description: Maintenance work on the toilets at Zoe Bay camping area will take place from Thursday 24 October to Friday 16 November. The toilets and camping area will remain open, but machinery and staff will be present. Affected parks: Thorsborne Trail, Hinchinbrook Island National Park; Hinchinbrook Island National Park.

item.title: Fox control program- 1080 Baiting at Southend Conservation Park, Curtis Island
item.description: Queensland Parks and Wildlife Service are again planning to conduct fox control activities in the Southend Conservation Park, Curtis Island for the upcoming turtle season. Foxes are a major problem, robbing a great many Flatback turtle nests each year from the rookery in the dune area of Front Beach Southend Conservation Park. Affected parks: Curtis Island National Park and Conservation Park.

item.title: Crows Nest National Park is closed due to wildfires.
item.description: Crows Nest National Park is closed due to wildfires within the National Park and surrounding country. At this stage Crows Nest National Park will be closed until Friday, 26 October 2012. Affected parks: Crows Nest National Park.

item.title: Carnarvon Great Walk Seasonal Closure
item.description: The annual closure of the Carnarvon Great Walk will take affect from the 1st November 2012 to the 25th March 2013. The Carnarvon Great Walk is closed at this time of year due to adverse seasonal conditions and being the hottest part of the year. Affected parks: Carnarvon Gorge, Carnarvon National Park; Carnarvon Great Walk; Mount Moffatt, Carnarvon National Park.

item.title: Campground closures in Main Range due to wildfire
item.description: Main Range National Park remote campgrounds are closed due to wildfires from Cunningham's Gap to Glen Rock. These campgrounds are Laidley Creek Falls campground, Point Pure campground and Glen Rock campground. At this stage Main Range National Park remote campgrounds will remain closed until Friday, 2 November 2012. Affected parks: Main Range National Park.

item.title: Fire Prohibition - Cooloola Recreation Area and Inskip Peninsula Recreation Area
item.description: Due to high fire danger, please be advised that from 24 October 2012 until further notice, fires must not be lit: In Cooloola, including Teewah Beach and Poverty Point campgrounds; In the Inskip Peninsula Recreation Area. The fire prohibition will remain in place until conditions moderate. Affected parks: Cooloola Recreation Area, Great Sandy National Park; Cooloola Great Walk; Inskip Peninsula Recreation Area.

item.title: "Auburn River Campground closed due to wildfire"
item.description: Auburn River Campground closed due to wildfires in the area Affected parks: Auburn River National Park.

item.title: Walking Track Closed
item.description: The track to the summit of Mt Edwards is closed due to wildfire. The access to Mt Edwards via the Moogerah Dam wall will be locked until further notice. Affected parks: Moogerah Peaks National Park.

item.title: Lockyer National Park closed due to fire
item.description: A wildfire is burning in Lockyer National Park. This has forced the closure of the entire Lockyer National Park. This Park Alert will be updated on or before 5:00pm Monday 29 October, 2012. Affected parks: Lockyer National Park.

item.title: Upgrade to the Mount Cook summit walking track, Mount Cook National Park
item.description: The Mount Cook summit walking track is being upgraded and some sections may be slippery. Affected parks: Mount Cook National Park.

item.title: Fraser Island Great Walk Closed - 18 October 2012 until further notice
item.description: The Fraser Island Great Walk is closed due to high fire danger conditions. The Great Walk will remain closed until a change in conditions reduces the fire threat. For your safety, do not enter closed tracks and please obey all signage and directions provided by QPWS staff. Affected parks: Fraser Island, Great Sandy National Park; Fraser Island Great Walk.

item.title: Cape Melville National Park feral animal control program
item.description: Feral animal control and fire activities will occur between 22nd and 27th October 2012. Control activities will occur in the area between the Muck River and Cape Melville and along the east coast south towards the Wakooka boundary. All campsites are closed for this period. Affected parks: Cape Melville National Park.

item.title: Road closures in Mt Mee section, D'Aguilar National Park
item.description: Due to logging operations in Mt Mee State Forest, Centipede Rd, Top Rd and the section of C Break north of Neurum Creek Rd is closed. Affected parks: D'Aguilar National Park.

item.title: Mast Head Island and Erskine Island park closure dates and Lady Musgrave and North West Islands camp closure dates
item.description: From 15 October 2012 until 28 March 2013 inclusive, all public access to Mast Head Island and Erskine Island will not be permitted. Lady Musgrave Island and North West Island will be closed to camping from 29 January 2013 until 28 March 2013 inclusive. These closures are to minimise human impact on vegetation, breeding seabirds and turtles. Affected parks: Capricornia Cays National Park.

item.title: Bluff Point - Closure due to maintenance
item.description: The car park ,picnic area and walking track will be closed from 9am Monday 12 November to 5pm Wednesday 14 November 2012. The walking track from Ritamada Lookout to the picnic area will remain closed until 5pm Friday 30 November. Affected parks: Capricorn Coast National Park.

item.title: Koombooloomba camping and day-use areas temporarily closed
item.description: Tully Falls Road is closed at Nitchaga Creek from 8 October to 14 December 2012 to replace the bridge. Affected parks: Koombooloomba National Park and Conservation Park.

item.title: Danbulla Road closed between Kauri Creek and School Point camping areas
item.description: Danbulla Road will be closed at Coi Creek between Kauri Creek and School Point camping areas until 7 December 2012 for bridge construction works by the Tablelands Regional Council. Affected parks: Danbulla National Park and State Forest.

item.title: Range Road closed Cathu State Forest
item.description: The Range Road beyond Jaxut Campground will remain CLOSED due to unsafe road conditions caused by land slips and washouts. Affected parks: Cathu State Forest.

item.title: Crediton State Forest Road Closure
item.description: Vehicle access on Cockies Creek Road from the Denham Range (Plavna) turnoff in Credition State Forest down to Captains Crossing in Mia Mia State Forest is closed until further notice due to severe damage to the road. Affected parks: Crediton State Forest; Mia Mia State Forest.

item.title: Change to smelter access in Chillagoe-Mungana Caves National Park
item.description: The restricted access area at the Chillagoe Smelters has been extended to cover all known areas with asbestos-containing material. Access for vehicles and people has been restricted to a safe viewing distance. A new lookout and signs are due to be installed during 2012. Affected parks: Chillagoe-Mungana Caves National Park.

item.title: Cedar Bay now part of Ngalba Bulal National Park
item.description: Cedar Bay National Park has now become the Mangkalba (Cedar Bay) section of Ngalba Bulal National Park. Affected parks: Cedar Bay National Park.

item.title: Plantation harvesting near Coochin Creek camp ground
item.description: Plantation harvesting operations will be conducted in the general area near the Coochin Creek camping and day use area from 12 September 2012. Some heavy vehicle traffic should be expected on adjacent forestry roads. Affected parks: Beerburrum and Beerwah State Forests.

item.title: All Cape York Peninsula touch screen camping booking facilities are currently unavailable
item.description: All Cape York Peninsula touch screen camping booking facilities are currently unavailable. Touch screens affected are at the Rinyirru (Lakefield) National Park (CYPAL), Kutini-Payamu (Iron Range) National Park (CYPAL), Heathlands Resources Reserve ranger bases and QPWS offices at Coen, Cooktown and Weipa. Camping bookings cannot currently be made at these locations. Refer to the camping section of each parks webpage for alternative booking options. Sorry for any inconvenience. Affected parks: Cape Melville National Park; Iron Range National Park; Jardine River National Park, Heathlands Resources Reserve and Jardine River Resources Reserve; Kutini-Payamu (Iron Range) National Park (CYPAL); Lakefield National Park; Mungkan Kandju (Kaanju) National Park; Rinyirru (Lakefield) National Park (CYPAL).

item.title: All Cape York Peninsula touch screen camping booking facilities are currently unavailable
item.description: All Cape York Peninsula touch screen camping booking facilities are currently unavailable. Touch screens affected are at the Rinyirru (Lakefield) National Park (CYPAL), Kutini-Payamu (Iron Range) National Park (CYPAL), Heathlands Resources Reserve ranger bases and QPWS offices at Coen, Cooktown and Weipa. Camping bookings cannot currently be made at these locations. Refer to the camping section of each parks webpage for alternative booking options. Affected parks: Cape York Peninsula parks and reserves.

item.title: Track work along the Thorsborne Trail, Hinchinbrook Island National Park
item.description: Machinery will be in use in sections along the Thorsborne Trail from 14 September to 12 November and Queensland Parks and Wildlife Service staff and contractors will sometimes be staying overnight during this time. Affected parks: Thorsborne Trail, Hinchinbrook Island National Park; Hinchinbrook Island National Park.

item.title: Limited camp sites at Wilderness Cove and Southern Beach camping areas.
item.description: Work being undertaken to repair damage from Cyclone Yasi at Wilderness Cove and Southern Beach camping areas may reduce the number of sites available. Consider alternative camping at The Spit (Western Beach). Affected parks: Goold Island National Park.

item.title: Gas barbeque at Murray Falls unavailable
item.description: The gas barbeque at the Murray Falls day-use area is currently unavailable. Affected parks: Girramay National Park; Murray Falls, Girramay National Park.

item.title: Temporary Closure Kroombit Tops National Park
item.description: Due to feral animal control operations the park will be closed from 5 pm Sunday 25 November 2012 to 5 pm Friday 30 November 2012. Tableland Road will be closed to through traffic during this time. Affected parks: Kroombit Tops National Park.

item.title: Rainforest walk closed
item.description: All facilities at Broadwater are open, with the exception of the Rainforest walk. This walk was damaged by Cyclone Yasi and is anticipated to open in 2013. Affected parks: Broadwater, Abergowrie State Forest.

item.title: Gas barbecues at Goldsborough Valley unavailable
item.description: The gas barbecues at Goldsborough Valley are currently unavailable. Affected parks: Goldsborough Valley, Wooroonooran National Park; Wooroonooran National Park.

item.title: Fraser Island Road Closures - updated 8 June 2012 until further notice
item.description: Severe weather in 2011 and earlier this year has created dangerous conditions on inland roads and at beach access points. The following roads are closed until further notice:*Southern Road south of Buff Creek, including access to Buff Creek and Garry's Anchorage. *the southern half of the Lake Garawongera scenic drive, between Lake Garawongera and Bogimbah Road. Affected parks: Fraser Island, Great Sandy National Park.

item.title: Walking track between Dugong and Sawmill closed for maintenance
item.description: QPWS Rangers are upgrading the walking track between Dugong and Sawmill on Whitsunday Island. Work will continue until the end of October 2012 and during this time the walking track will be closed to the public. Affected parks: Whitsunday Islands National Park; Whitsunday Ngaro Sea Trail; Whitsunday national park islands.

item.title: Middle Island Closure
item.description: Public access to Middle Island in the Keppel Bay Islands National Park is prohibited from 8 October, 2012 to 30 November,2012 inclusive. This includes all public access above the high water mark and Northeastern Beach, Southeastern Beach and Northwestern Beach camping areas. Rangers will be undertaking pest animal control. Affected parks: Keppel Bay Islands National Park.

item.title: Current campground access
item.description: Charlie Moreland campground access is open from the eastern end of Sunday Creek Road via Kenilworth-Maleny Road. Sunday Creek Road to Jimna from Charlie Moreland campground is closed due to landslips and dangerous road conditions. Jimna State Forest and Peach Trees campground are open via Kilcoy-Murgon Road. Booloumba Creek camping area access is open to high clearance 4WD vehicles only along Booloumba Creek Road. Affected parks: Conondale National Park; Conondale Range Great Walk; Imbil State Forest; Jimna State Forest.

item.title: Mount Moffatt road closure due to road damage
item.description: Mount Moffatt section of the Carnarvon National Park have some roads and areas closed to the public due the the road damage caused by the heavy rain fall. Affected parks: Mount Moffatt, Carnarvon National Park.

item.title: Dingo Safety - Dingo Whelping Season - September and October 2012
item.description: An increase in dingo-human interactions is expected during dingo whelping season. This is a particularly important time for pups to learn natural hunting and survival skills and to avoid habituation towards people. Visitors, tour operators and residents are advised to follow dingo safety advice provided, remain vigilant with dingo safety and avoid interaction with dingoes at all times. Affected parks: Fraser Island Great Walk; Fraser Island, Great Sandy National Park.

item.title: Mt Beerwah summit trail closed to all visitors.
item.description: For safety, Mt Beerwah summit trail including access to the cliff face are closed to all visitors until further notice. Text: Affected parks: Beerburrum and Beerwah State Forests; Glass House Mountains National Park.

item.title: Commencing 13 October: QPWS Rainbow Beach Information Centre CLOSED weekends and public holidays.
item.description: Due to recent enlisting of additional permit issuing agents that are able to process camping and vehicle access permit sales in Rainbow Beach, the Queensland Parks and Wildlife Service Visitor Information Centre operating hours will change on 13 October. Affected parks: Cooloola Great Walk; Cooloola Recreation Area, Great Sandy National Park; Fraser Island Great Walk; Fraser Island, Great Sandy National Park; Inskip Peninsula Recreation Area.

item.title: Beach and track hazard - Inskip Peninsula Recreation Area
item.description: Due to severe natural erosion events observed in July 2011, semi-permanent depressions have developed in a section of beach between the navigational lead lights and the barge landing area. Affected parks: Inskip Peninsula Recreation Area.

item.title: Dalrymple Gap walking track partially open
item.description: The section from the northern (Cardwell) end to the top of the Dalrymple Gap is open. This walk was significantly damaged by Cyclone Yasi and it is anticipated that the southern (Ingham) end of the walk will reopen by November 2012. Affected parks: Dalrymple Gap walking track, Girringun National Park; Girringun National Park.

item.title: Facilities closed at Edmund Kennedy, Girramay National Park
item.description: Cyclone Yasi caused extensive damage at Edmund Kennedy. Clift Road is open to the beach but major reconstruction is required to reopen other facilities. It is anticipated work will be completed in 2013. Affected parks: Edmund Kennedy, Girramay National Park; Girramay National Park.

item.title: Partial walking track closure, Stanley Island, Flinders Group National Park
item.description: Ship Shelter, a rock art site on the Yindayin rock shelter walking track on Stanley Island, is closed due to the detection of movement of the rock overhang. The stability of the site is being investigated. The Yindayin shelter rock art site and the bush tucker walk can still be accessed but the Yindayin rock shelter walking track cannot be completed as a circuit. Affected parks: Flinders Group National Park.

item.title: Southern section closed for nature and culture study
item.description: Please be aware than the southern end of Naree Budjong Djara National Park on North Stradbroke Island is currently closed to the public. A temporary restricted access area covers Stingaree Island and lands adjacent to Swan Bay. This temporary closure will remain in place to allow the assessment of the natural and cultural values to take place. Affected parks: Naree Budjong Djara National Park.

item.title: Partial walking track closure, Fitzroy Island National Park
item.description: For your safety, access to the lookouts at the top of the Summit track have been closed. Affected parks: Fitzroy Island National Park.

item.title: Kirrama National Park closed
item.description: Cyclone Yasi caused extensive damage to Kirrama National Park. It is anticipated the park will reopen in 2013. Affected parks: Kirrama National Park.

item.title: Changes to walking tracks, Magnetic Island National Park
item.description: To improve visitor safety on the walking track from Arcadia to Horseshoe Bay, the section along Horseshoe Bay Road has been closed. Affected parks: Magnetic Island National Park.

item.title: Bridge on Maalan Road closed, Misty Mountains
item.description: The bridge, at the western end of the unsealed Maalan Road, is closed for safety reasons. Affected parks: Misty Mountains wilderness walking tracks.

item.title: No rubbish collection at Fong-On Bay and School Point camping areas, Danbulla State Forest
item.description: Due to bridge damage on Danbulla Road, rubbish collection is no longer provided at Fong-On Bay and School Point camping areas. Campers must take rubbish home or place it in the extra bins at the turn-offs to Platypus and Downfall Creek camping areas. Affected parks: Danbulla National Park and State Forest.

item.title: Fires Prohibited
item.description: Fires are prohibited on Fraser Island. Fuel stoves are recommended for cooking. Affected parks: Fraser Island Great Walk; Fraser Island, Great Sandy National Park.

item.title: Purling Brook circuit track CLOSURE
item.description: Eastern side of Pulring Brook circuit track - CLOSED Affected parks: Springbrook National Park.

item.title: Natural Bridge electric barbeques - OUT OF ORDER
item.description: Natural Bridge electric barbeques are not working. Affected parks: Springbrook National Park.

item.title: Gap Creek track closed
item.description: The Gap Creek track is closed until further notice for safety reasons. Affected parks: Cedar Bay National Park.

item.title: Part closure, Macushla to Cape Richards walking track, Hinchinbrook Island National Park.
item.description: The Macushla to Cape Richards walking track is closed from Cape Richards to the Northern end of the beach in North Shepherd Bay. Affected parks: Hinchinbrook Island National Park.

item.title: Vehicles prohibited by Regulatory Notice Bullock Creek Claypan
item.description: A Regulatory Notice under the Marine Parks Act 2004 has been declared to prohibit vehicles in the Bullock Creek Claypan to protect shorebird and saltmarsh habitat and allow damaged habitat to recover. This Regulatory Notice will remain in force unless revoked by the Chief Executive. Contravention of this notice carries penalties. Affected parks: Moreton Bay Marine Park.

item.title: Mobo Creek Crater circuit walk closed
item.description: The circuit walk is temporarily closed until significant track surface repairs can be undertaken. It is anticipated the track will reopen by December 2012. Affected parks: Danbulla National Park and State Forest.

item.title: Fire trail maintenance works occurring in Mapleton National Park
item.description: Fire trail maintenance works in Mapleton National Park have commenced. Affected parks: Mapleton National Park.

item.title: Prescribed burns, Bowling Green Bay National Park
item.description: Queensland Parks and Wildlife Service (QPWS) will be conducting prescribed burns in sections of Cape Cleveland and Mount Elliot of Bowling Green Bay National Park from Early May 2012 to late October 2012 with fires expected to burn for days depending on weather conditions. Please pay close attention to all signage, and QPWS staff on the ground as some walking tracks may be closed at these times. Serious injury or death could result from entering these areas. Persons with respiratory or other health problems that may be aggravated by smoke inhalation should take suitable precautions as fires may cause smoke hazards to visitors of Alligator Creek. Affected parks: Bowling Green Bay National Park.

item.title: Cooloola Great Walk temporary track detour
item.description: Queensland Parks and Wildlife Service have created a temporary detour on the Cooloola Great Walk in the vacinity of the 3rd beach cutting on Noosa North Shore. Affected parks: Cooloola Great Walk; Cooloola Recreation Area, Great Sandy National Park.
